greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k such that k*prime(n)# + 1 is prime where prime(n)# is the n-th primorial number A002110(n).
comment: This is certified for the first 3100 primes a(n)*prime(n)#+1.
link: Pierre CAMI, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3100
mathematica: With[{P = FoldList[Times, Prime@ Range@ 120]}, Table[k = 1; While[CompositeQ[k P[[n]] + 1], k++]; k, {n, Length@ P}]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 18 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=1, pr = prod(i=1, n, prime(i))); while (! isprime(k*pr+1), k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 09 2017
xref: Cf. A014545 (n for which k=1), A073917 (the primes).
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Nov 10 2002
